databaseSchema.title: DatabaseSchema
databaseSchema.description: databaseSchema of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single databaseSchema. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the databaseSchema.

oracleServiceName.title: Oracle Service Name
oracleServiceName.description: The Oracle Service name is the TNS alias that you give when you remotely connect to your database.

oracleTNSConnection.title: Oracle TNS Connection String
oracleTNSConnection.description: Pass the full constructed TNS string, e.g., (DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=myhost)(PORT=1530)))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=MYSERVICENAME))).

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to connect to Oracle. This user should have privileges to read all the metadata in Oracle.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and port of the Oracle service.

oracleConnectionType.title: Oracle Connection Type
oracleConnectionType.description: Connect with oracle by either passing service name or database schema name.

databaseSchema.title: DatabaseSchema
databaseSchema.description: databaseSchema of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single databaseSchema. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the databaseSchema.

oracleServiceName.title: Oracle Service Name
oracleServiceName.description: The Oracle Service name is the TNS alias that you give when you remotely connect to your database.

oracleTNSConnection.title: Oracle TNS Connection String
oracleTNSConnection.description: Pass the full constructed TNS string, e.g., (DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS_LIST=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=myhost)(PORT=1530)))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=MYSERVICENAME))).

instantClientDirectory.title: Oracle instant client directory
instantClientDirectory.description: This directory will be used to set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH env variable. It is required if you need to enable thick connection mode. By default, we bring instant client 19 and point to /instantclient.

databaseName.title: Database Name
databaseName.description: Optional name to give to the database in OpenMetadata. If left blank, we will use default as the database name.

connectionOptions.title: Connection Options
connectionOptions.description: Additional connection options to build the URL that can be sent to service during the connection.

connectionArguments.title: Connection Arguments
connectionArguments.description: Additional connection arguments such as security or protocol configs that can be sent to service during connection.

supportsQueryComment.title: Supports Query Comment
supportsQueryComment.description: For Database Services using SQLAlchemy, True to enable running a comment for all queries run from OpenMetadata.
